history.content: Oops. Please talk to your advisor about this. Since this is a situation so specific to your case, we cannot provide any help or advice, sorry.

Students must declare the major program in order to receive a degree in it. Completing the degree requirements does not mean that you would be admitted to the major. Please continue to complete the degree requirements for the major you are declared in.

children.subject: Just a heads up you could try the data science major if it doesnt work out, you have finished most of the requirements

It may be possible to declare the data science major as suggested above and then minor in CS. You should talk to an advisor asap though because you've probably racked up a good amount of units as a 2nd year transfer and you don't want to hit the unit ceiling. As a transfer myself I know how hard transfers have it, but hopefully everything works out for you.

history.content:
I am 2nd year transfer student. I was too rushed to take CS lower divisions and ended up with 3.10 GPA. My appeal was denied.

However, I am completing 5th upper division requirement for L&S Computer Scienece degree. If I take 2 more CS or Elective, I will finish all upper / lower division requirement. I checked the policy on the website. It said the degree requires the completion of Major & breadth requirement didn’t specifically saying declaring major itself.

Does that make me eligible for the degree?

If not, is there any place / person I can appeal to,,,? Because I just feel it’s not right to be rejected by degree just because my lower division GPA is lower by 0.2,, I am also not sure if I can afford out of state tuition for the semesters to complete my alternative major
history.subject: Rejected by major but compelete CS degree program
